titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: went with them. Then Ella & M

Berry went to Scotland: & I went to Mattins in the Cathedral. Next I turned my thoughts to the preparation of the sermon for the cryptic Huguenots. The occasion, as described by the pastor, is a two–fold celebration – Thanksgiving for Deliverance from the Spanish Armada, and also for the Reformation inaugurated by Luther's Theses. I began to read a Jesuit life of the great Reformer ("Luther" by Hartman Grisar S.J. 1913) and found it extremely interesting, as well as very informing. I received a very pleasant letter form
& her sister over the Deanery, & took Logic for a walk. Then I wrote to Ella, enclosing for her reading,
letter which was communicative in unusual degree.
